results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Swiss Society for Combating Cancer
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: Trip to Mars
results.brief_description: Magical animation details the extraterrestial adventures of hand-drawn harlequin, Koko the clown. Reluctant astronaut Koko inadvertantly launches Mr. Fleischer skyward and the two conclude their supernatural reverie in a ‘taxi-crab’ flung to the rings of Saturn. Koko’s martian odyssey reveals a wealth of unlikely and outlandish natives.

results.title: Make the Most of Your Roast
results.creator_credit: Robert Knapp and Meat and Livestock Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Meat makes the meal”.
Produced for the Australian Meat Board, this film demonstrates clearly and simply the steps essential in making a good roast. Tips such as keeping the oven temperature low, placing the meat on a grill and using a meat thermometer are explained and demonstrated.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Aram Boyajian, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: A Floral pageant
results.brief_description: Victoria celebrates 100 years of self government. Shots of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Government House, but mainly the procession along Elizabeth Street. Beginning title says “Presented by Ted Waterford”.

results.title: [Matthew Flinders: bi-centennial celebrations 1974]
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board, Department of Agriculture and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Captures the various bi-centennial celebrations that were organised in Victoria to commemorate the birth of Captain Matthew Flinders. Includes footage of the Shrine; Mornington beach; Arthur’s Seat; Port Philip Bay; Station Peaks; Flinder’s Street Station; St Paul’s Cathedral; Swanston street; and the Matthew Flinders torch relay. Leading Victorian figures appear unveiling commemorative plaques. This is an un-edited film without a soundtrack which documents many of the celebrations.

results.title: Tour of Tasmania, February 1950
results.brief_description: Home movie travelogue of Tasmania shot in February 1950. Includes scenes of several historic buildings and sites, and of Swansea, Port Arthur, Hobart and Cataract Gorge. No credits available.

results.title: Wandering Thru' the Centre
results.brief_description:
A travel film through the centre of Australia. Features the Flying Doctor’s Base at Alice Springs, The Devil’s Marble near Wanchop, Darwin beach and harbour and many other tourist delights to be found en route from Alice Springs to Darwin.

Digitising Technician Note: Film contains footage of the making of “The Overlanders” (1946). Noted by Ben Abbott 09/01/2018

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963 [Work print]
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Work print footage of the royal visit in 1963. Includes aerial views of Melbourne, the arrival of the royal yacht, The Queen and Price Phillip being greeted by dignitaries, the inspection of troops, passing crowds in a Rolls Royce, the arrival at a racetrack and a reception at the Melbourne Town Hall
